column3: I believe this is a sufficient fix for #9857.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9866/commits/1e9e320dc98a69661484842bfde9d1c24fb52ecb

Maybe we should (in other PR) add a small doc about using Bitcoin Core on low-memory systems (recommendation for IBD, for normal run, blocksonly etc.).

utACK

> Maybe we should (in other PR) add a small doc about using Bitcoin Core on low-memory systems (recommendation for IBD, for normal run, blocksonly etc.).

I have [such a document](https://gist.github.com/laanwj/efe29c7661ce9b6620a7) though it's not been updated in a while so some things are probably no longer relevant.
ACK.\n\nIt may be worth it to also update @laanwj's low-memory suggestions, and include it in the doc/ directory?

> It may be worth it to also update @laanwj's low-memory suggestions, and include it in the doc/ directory?\n\nYes that would be useful, I planned to do that at some point when the document was ready. But it was never ready because things are always changing :)
(Sorry for trickling my review comments, but I was about to ACK and then just noticed this:)  Perhaps "IBD" is too much jargon for release notes?
Hmm, "initial block download" was mentioned a few lines up...I clarified there.
